mindbody.name: Senior Software Engineer - Mindbody
mindbody.description:
US company with a SaaS solution for fitness, wellness and beauty businesses around the world.
I work on a team responsible for redesigning and modernizing technology processes within the company.
Project 1: Creating a project from scratch to replace the company's legacy solution, which synchronized millions of records between Snowflake and Salesforce and had high license costs, performance issues, and error handling issues. Another developer and I created the design together, discussed it with the team, and I developed the project alone. The result was an 80% reduction in project costs (50k USD to 10k USD), a significant improvement in error handling (which previously practically didn't exist), and an improvement in record processing time. Technologies: C#, .NET, New Relic, Kubernetes, Docker, Azure DevOps, AWS, Snowflake, SNS, SQS, AWS Lambda.
Project 2: Creating a project from scratch to replace the company's legacy solution for processing payments and subscriptions. The rest of the description is identical to "Project 1," so I won't repeat it. An additional comment is that this project significantly improved error handling, allowing orders and subscriptions to be reprocessed with just one click without fear of generating duplicate charges.

zup.name: Senior Software Engineer - Zup Innovation
zup.description:
I work in the insurance area of a client in the banking/financial sector with microservices in Java Spring Boot and TypeScript NodeJS.
Project 1: Increase the number of insurance proposals contracted. The approach was based on scheduled reminders. I designed the architecture, brought it to the team for discussion and developed the solution. Thanks to the reminders, 17 thousand proposals were formalized in one year. Technologies: TypeScript, NodeJS, Java, Apache Kafka, AWS DynamoDB, AWS Lambda, AWS ECS, AWS EventBridge Scheduler, AWS SNS, AWS SQS.
Project 2: Extract insurance proposal data from our database and save it in a partitioned S3 bucket so that the data and analytics team can perform SQL queries in Amazon Athena. The result of this project is the democratization of data and the possibility of discovering new insights about the business. Technologies: AWS DynamoDB, DynamoDB Streams, AWS Lambda, AWS Step Functions, AWS EventBridge Scheduler, AWS Glue, Apache Spark, Python, Terraform, CI/CD, Grafana, Prometheus.
Project 3: Enable my team to test new things in the development environment. The context of this problem is that we could only test things after deploying them in a staging environment, and this is not ideal. My job was to review the team's entire microservices architecture and put together a plan to adjust all applications and make them work in the development environment. The result of this project was an increase in the team's productivity as it was able to iterate faster on new developments.

google.name: Software Engineer - Google
google.description:
I worked within the Google Search product area maintaining Data Engineering solutions (similar to Google Flume, Google Dataflow, Apache Beam, Apache Flink) that process billions of logs every day and help Google evaluate its own products through satisfaction surveys sent directly to real users (e.g. Google Opinion Rewards App).
I also worked on some additional projects:
Project 1: I was responsible for creating scheduled jobs that process billions of data points and generate tables that are later used to create dashboards that help monitor the health of an internal system. Technologies: Python, SQL, and some other built-in ones (similar to Prometheus metrics).
Project 2: I developed frontend and backend components that help internal users create surveys more easily without having to know the details of my team's data engineering pipeline. This project reduced the time to create surveys from hours to minutes and also helped increase the adoption of the tool that my team offers. Technologies: Kotlin, C++, RPC/gRPC, Protocol Buffers, Blaze/Bazel, Google Cloud, TypeScript, JavaScript, NodeJS, React, GraphQL, Apollo, relational databases.

accenture.name: Application Development Analyst - Accenture
accenture.description:
Project 1: I was assigned to understand a need of the SAP team at Accenture and create a solution from scratch, including layout, frontend (React), backend (Node), database (Postgres) and infrastructure on AWS (EC2, S3 and RDS). This project allowed the SAP team to register projects created in the past and quickly search for them to reuse them in new projects.
Project 2: I worked as a React front-end technical lead. Our mission was to improve the accessibility of several websites of a large healthcare company in Brazil. This involves testing screen readers, color contrast, and other things described in the WCAG standards. Our client used evidence generated during the project to respond to a legal process and gave us positive feedback on the quality of the project and the progress of the legal process. Technologies: JavaScript, React, NodeJS, Azure DevOps, CI/CD, Git Flow, WCAG, Technical Refinement.

internIoasys.name: Full Stack Development Intern - Ioasys
internIoasys.description:
Project 1: I developed an authentication integration via SAML 2.0 using NodeJS and AWS Lambda. This project allowed us to integrate a new client into our project through their Azure Active Directory.
Project 2: I was a developer of a Ruby on Rails API that functions as an enterprise social media application. This was a big challenge because in 2 weeks I had to take over the project alone (as an intern!!) and was responsible for the infrastructure on AWS, the backend development, deployments, and schema migrations in the production database. Technologies: Ruby, Ruby on Rails, Active Record, AWS EC2, AWS RDS (MySQL), AWS S3, Nginx, SSL/TLS certificates, SSH.
